Posts.Content: grannydiva,   some words of encouragement.....I am a 25 year survivor of breast cancer after I originally had a double masectomy at the age of 30.  After a year of chemo and the surgery so long ago, I'm still here.  Now, an interesting side note, I developed a different type of breast cancer two years ago.  Again, the surgery, the chemo and now Arimidex.  Still plugging along.  Never did I regret my decision for the masectomy surgery.  I certainly was depressed and upset sometimes about the physical manifestations of the surgery but I do believe it saved my life.  I am here today to love and enjoy my grandchildren and expect to do so for many more years.  Keep heart.  This disease is survivable but it very important that you approach your treatments very aggressively.
Posts.Title: feeling alone

Posts.Title: feeling alone

Posts.Content: On 9/10/2007 christy1975 wrote: Hi, I am a 31 year old mom of 2. I have been told by a breast specialist that i have some fibrocrstic tissue in my left breast, but lately my right breast seems to be a bit larger than my left breast. I don't know if it matters or not but I don't get normal periods and havent had one this month I am about a week late and am not sure if this could be related, I plan on going to the doctors I just wanted to get some info on what this could possible be before I go. I don't have any other symptoms. Hi, I am 57 and have had breast cancer twice.  My experience both times was an unusual lump or formation and that the specific area was warm.  Just felt different that the other tissue.  Not sure about the whole breast being larger but would try not to worry.  Also your age is on your side.
Posts.Title: Could this be cancer?
